content.description: Start as for Fun Dungeon, but make a move out right to obvious hand on overhanging face. Set feet and dyno to the crystal lip (warning: sharp). Finish up and right.
content.protection: Several pads and a spotter to prevent slide down hill on fall.

content.description: Starting on the obvious block below the roof, dyno to the lip and top out. Multiple hold options for the dyno.
content.protection: Pad. Good landing. Can be worked solo.
content.location: Not on the S&M Boulder, but in obvious low cave just to the right.

content.description: On the uphill side of the boulder, start underneath the boulder on left hand pinch and right side pull with good feet. Move straight up on big moves and top out.
content.protection: A bit of a tight fit with the dead tree, so you'll want a few pads.

content.description: Fun little traverse problem. Start on decent hold near large tree. Traverse the lip up/left. Top out at Sebi's dyno. Kind of tight with the tree in such close proximity but a decent problem nonetheless.
content.location: Not actually on the S&M boulder. If you are looking at S&M boulder, turn around and you'll be facing a short, overhanging boulder. Start on the far right side of that boulder in front of a large tree.

content.description: The best line on the boulder. Start underneath the boulder, below the start for Beat Me Gently. Pull on with your right hand on a low juggy sidepull and your left on the good features on the arete. Follow features to the right up the overhanging arete to top out where a band of huge crystals juts out of the top of the boulder. Great climbing on cool features, but a bit sharp.
content.location: Obvious overhung arete on the S&M boulder.

content.description: Start with opposing side pull crimps in the middle of the overhung face, pull on a toe around the right edge of the boulder, and then slap the right hand to the lip of the boulder. Get both toe-hooks on and bump the right hand up to the best position you can find on the lip and then bring the left hand up to match the lip, stalling a swing. Readjust the feet from toe-hook to heels, find a big ol' edge on the top of the boulder and pull and easy mantle over the lip.
content.location: Directly to the right of Sebi's Dyno, adjacent to the the S&M boulder. Both are visible through the trees from the red/green trails when walking through the Second Talus Area.

content.description: Really fun problem that makes use of the varied holds on S&M's backside.   Start crouched at the base of the arete on matched hands. Continue up the arete using all available holds until you reach the top out jug (avoiding vegetation at top).   If desired, you could make this harder by using just the holds on the arete (but the dead tree makes this somewhat difficult at the moment).
content.protection: The tree makes things tight and it should be padded - a spotter moving a half pad works nicely.

content.description: Start on some good knobs on the side of the boulder facing the trail and climb up and to the right. S and M have both climbed this problem.
Sit start on some good holds underneath the boulder and climb up and to the left, finishing in the same place as Beginner's Guide to S&M.
content.location: Just to the right of Beginner's Guide to S&M.

content.description: This is a North-pointing prow located roughly in the middle of the second talus area. It is named after Sebi and Matt.
